newsitem.title: USA: Hudson restates Q1 earnings to loss.
newsitem.headline: Hudson restates Q1 earnings to loss.

text.p: Hudson Technologies Inc said Friday it had made a downward revision of its earnings for the first quarter of the year after finding that "accounting policies and estimates" made during their preparation were wrong.
Hudson said in a statement the restatement led to a net loss of $700,000 or $0.14 per share on revenues of $8.0 million.
A company officials said it had reported a net profit of $235,000 or $0.05 per share on revenues of $9.0 million when it reported the quarterly earnings for the first time in April.
"There were accounting policies and estimates made during the preparation of the first-quarter statements that were incorrect," he said.
Hudson also reported a loss of $0.57 per share for the second quarter, against a loss of $0.15 for the same period a year ago.

The company, which recovers and reclaims refrigerants, said the poor results for the second quarter and six-month period were due to an "unseasonably cool" spring and an unanticipated decline in demand and prices for some of its products.
